Draft: Accessible Request Page

Good and Bad Demonstration

Forms at Deque University

There are 3 errors in this form.

  • 'Initials': No initials is entered, please enter up to 6 initials
  • 'Insertion': An abbreviations is used. Write the insertion completely like 'van der' and not 'v/d'
  • 'Citizen service number': Only 8 numbers are entered

With this form, you will request a Credit Card. Within 5 business days you'll receive an answer for acceptance. On the Credit Card page you can find more information about the impact of the application for your account.

Before filling in the form please make sure you have the following items ready:
  • Digital copy Passport
  • Citizen service number
  • Bank account number
  • Data partner

NOTE: All fields in this form are required, unless otherwise specified.

Request a credit card in 2 steps

  2. 2 Additional information

Introducing A11ycasts! -- A11ycasts #01

Annotations

01. Content provides a logical and hierarchical heading structure

A good heading structure enables people to scan a page/screen quickly and understand the structure of the content. Screen reader users can also use headings to quickly navigate within a page or screen.

Other things to consider, in order to make headings more usable for screen reader users:

  • Lists and headings used together to mark up content should be avoided
  • For a correct heading outline it is sometimes necessary to hide them visually
  • Headings should be coded around content that doesn’t change, i.e. a category name such as ‘Banking News’ rather than a news item that will update frequently
  • Headings should not overwhelm a page as this can undermine their usefulness for screen reader users when navigating, a maximum of 7-9 headings should suffice

Note! Improvements on the template are propagated throughout the entire website

HTML Example

WCAG Success Criteria

  • 1.3.1 Info and Relationships Level A
    • H42: Using h1-h6 to identify headings
    • G141: Organizing a page using headings
  • 2.4.10 Section Headings Level AAA
    • G141: Organizing a page using headings
    • H69: Providing heading elements at the beginning of each section of content
